results.title: Peter's chair
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Using Ezra Jack Keats book as a basis, this film tells of the jealousy Peter feels at the arrival of his baby sister and how his world is put to rights again. Good use of music and amusing and entertaining voice-overs.

results.title: Pesticides
results.creator_credit: Robert Richter, Thirteen and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Pesticides and pills for export only”.
The film presents evidence that products banned or restricted in developed countries because of their danger to humans or the environment are knowingly exported to the Third World by multinational corporations. This episode investigates the trade in pesticides.

results.title: Peru people of the Andes
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explores the Chincheros Valley near Cuzco and contrasts the community life in a self contained Indian Village with that of the tenant farmers who work on the haciendas. Illustrates Peru’s recent economic progress as evidenced in the new mining camps, transportation facilities and the wealth which is concentrated in Lima. (Revision of 1940 film, “Peru”.)

results.title: Perth's Mitchell Freeway
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: The application of the Mitchell Freeway plan to Perth, its immediate advantage in handling growing traffic densities and the long term implications of city development, are seen in their close inter-relationships.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit

results.title: Personality: Middle childhood
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personality”.
The middle years are a time of increasing independence for children, finding a place among peers, arriving at new concepts of self, mastering new skills. The important role of parents in the development of a child’s self-esteem and self-confidence is discussed.

results.title: Personality conflict
results.brief_description: A dramatized example of what happens when two conflicting personalities must work together. Designed to stimulate discussion on the adjustment that supervisors must make, Peter is rather retiring, particular and conscious of his position, His new assistant, Jim, is exuberant and almost aggressively well-meaning. Pete dislikes Jim’s suggestions on altering routines and resents his attitude even more. When he overhears Jim discussing the situation with other men in the cafeteria he is extremely angry, calls Pete into his office and has it out with him. Neither is satisfied and Pete takes the situation to the personnel manager, who tells him it is too late to make a change and that he is capable of making the adjustment. The audience is asked: how should Pete handle Jim?
